definitions: the conditions under which land or buildings are held or occupied.

examples.text: his tenure of the premiership would be threatened

definitions: a period for which an office is held.
guaranteed permanent employment, especially as a teacher or lecturer, after a probationary period; security of tenure

examples.text: tenure for university staff has been abolished

definitions: give (someone) a permanent post, especially as a teacher or lecturer

examples.text: I had recently been tenured and then promoted to full professor
